summary:
An enthusiastic and self-driven professional with an international profile. Nineteen years of professional experience:
•	4 years in teaching and research
•	4 years as Regional Manager 
•	2 years as Project Coordinator 
•	3 years as Public Relations Officer
Extensive knowledge in human rights and development issues. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Proven managerial and organizational competencies.

profile_positions.description:
•	Co- lecturer for the following courses: Perspectives on Globalisation, Global Governance and International Organizations and International Political Economy
•	Supervisor for graduate students´ thesis work
profile_positions.title: Universitetsadjunkt (Adjunct Lecturer)

profile_positions.description:
Actively contributed to teaching and research at the Department of Social Studies, while maintaining flexibility in fulfilling various tasks. My responsibilities typically included the following: 
•	Teaching and supervising undergraduate and graduate students. 
•	Developing and managing the class syllabus and ensuring that the syllabus meets department and the university standards
•	Planning and creating lectures, in-class discussions, and assignments.
•	Grading assigned papers, quizzes, and exams
•	Assessing grades for students based on participation, performance in class, assignments, and examinations.
•	Collaborating with colleagues on course curriculum

Courses Taught 
1SO156	Global Migration
1SO154	Culture and Interpersonal Interaction
1SH155	Global Governance and International Organisations
profile_positions.title: Graduate Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Oversaw the lunch of the Child and Youth Finance (CYF) Movement in Sub-Saharan Africa, and led the development and implementation of the network´s strategy.  My primary responsibilities included:
•	Actively network, identified and pursued growth opportunities within the CYF Movement
•	Supervising program activities in all partner countries, including the core activities: Policy development, Global Money Week (GMW), SchoolBank, Economic Citizenship Education (ECE) and Youth Entrepreneurship (Ye!)
•	Supervise all regional events: annual regional meetings, workshops, training programs, and national stakeholder meetings.
•	Design and organise professional development programs for different CYFI partners and collaborators
•	Working directly with governments, regional organisations and other national stakeholders in developing strategies for financial inclusion and education. Specifically, advise and provide technical support on making such strategies children and youth focus
•	Led fundraising and proposal writing activities for the region.
•	Work closely with other Regional Program Managers to assess, grow and improve global CYF programs
•	Monitor and reporting on CYF key performance indicators (KPIs) data through Salesforce, and contributing to the Secretariat´s publications including annual reports.
profile_positions.title: Regional Manager, Africa

profile_positions.description:
•	Co-authored proposals and raised funds to establish a quarterly choral music event: “An Evening with Ghanaian Composers Series.”  
•	Co-planned and project managed the maiden and three editions of the event featuring locally renowned composers Professor Yaw Sakyi-Baidoo, Tsemafo Arthur, Ken Kafui, and Newlove Annan.
•	Built strong community relations with subcontractors and vendors to optimise cost savings and ensure timely completion of projects. 
•	Negotiated contracts with vendors to achieve optimal performance within budget parameters.
•	Co-authored project reports, including budget information to funders.
•	Wrote promotional materials and press release.
•	Co-produced a radio program, “Hymns and their stories.”
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
•	Worked closely with the Public Relations Manager to establish and deliver to the communication needs of the Chamber of Mines.
•	Researched, wrote and distributed press releases to targeted media.
•	Collated and analysed media coverage on Chamber and its members' activities.
•	Wrote speeches and prepared visual presentations for the CEO.
•	Wrote stories, co-edited and managed the production of the maiden edition of the Chamber of Mines´ newsletter, “Chamber News.”
•	Co-authored and managed a newspaper column on “Mining and Life.” 
•	Collaborated with the CEO, PR Manager and members of the Chamber of Mines to devise public relations campaigns and coordinate host community events.
•	Cultivated network of media and communications professionals to maintain strong partnerships, secure positive coverage and facilitate quick dissemination of information.
•	Responded to public and media inquiries on mining activities in Ghana, and facilitated connections between researchers and members of the Chamber of Mines. 
•	Maintained effective networking to continually grow stakeholder contacts and increase public awareness of members’ safe mining practices and corporate social responsibility (CSR) programs.
profile_positions.title: Public Relations Assistant (NSP)
